title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1225.1 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1225.1 - Definitions

State Regulations

As used herein: (a) Automotive vehicle shall mean any highway
vehicle which is self propelled, and shall include the combination of a tractor
and semi-trailer. (b) Day shall mean
a period of 24 hours, or any fraction thereof, beginning at midnight. (c) Driver shall mean the person who is in
actual physical control of a vehicle. (d) Executive director shall mean the
executive director of The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey or his
successor in office or duties. (e) Freight shall include all commodities as listed in the National Motor Freight

Classification No. 9 (MF-I.C.C. No. 17) issued by C. F. Jackson, agent, and on
file with the Interstate Commerce Commission, including all reissues thereof or
supplements thereto; except the following, which are excluded: (1)

Commodities which cannot physically be
handled at a truck terminal; (2)

Commodities in bulk; (3)

Commodities subject to deterioration, damage or spoilage due to atmospheric or
other weather conditions; (4)

Commodities requiring refrigeration, ventilation or heating; (5)

Live animals, birds, fish and
reptiles; (6)

Class A explosives, Class B explosives or Class A poisons, all as defined in the I.C.C. regulations; (7)

Baled fibres, including but not limited to, sisal and hemp (except when permission to handle
the same has been obtained in advance); provided, however, that by notice given within 60 days
after the effective date of any such reissue or supplement, the Port Authority
may exclude any commodity first listed therein. (f) Freight handling vehicle shall mean any
vehicle used only within a truck terminal. (g) Highway vehicle shall mean any vehicle
used both within and without a truck terminal. (h) Holiday shall mean New Year's Day; Lincoln's Birthday; Washington's Birthday; Memorial Day; Independence Day; Labor Day; Columbus Day; Election Day; Armistice Day; Thanksgiving Day and

Christmas Day. (i) I.C.C. regulations shall mean the regulations of the Interstate Commerce Commission in
effect on the effective date hereof, issued under the authority contained in
sections 831-835, inclusive, of title 18 of the U. S. Code, entitled "Crime and

Criminal Procedure", and included in parts 71 to 85, inclusive, of title 49 of
the Code of Federal Regulations, dealing with the transportation of explosives
and other dangerous articles by motor carriers by highway. (j) Operator shall mean the owner of a
vehicle, or any person who has rented such vehicle for operation by himself or
his own agents. (k) Parking shall
mean the halting of a vehicle on a roadway or other area while not actually
engaged in receiving or discharging freight, unless in obedience to traffic
regulations or traffic signs or signals, and regardless of whether or not the
driver remains in the vehicle. (l) Permission shall mean permission granted by the superintendent, unless
otherwise specifically provided. (m) Person shall mean any individual, firm, copartnership, corporation, association
or company (including any assignee, receiver, trustee or similar representative
thereof) or the United States of America or any State or political subdivision
thereof, or any foreign government or political subdivision thereof, or the

United Nations. (n) Port Authority
shall mean The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey. (o) Port Authority rules and regulations
shall mean the rules and regulations set forth in this Part and any future
amendments and supplements. (p) Semi-trailer shall mean a highway vehicle, not self-propelled, designed and
constructed to be towed and to move with the forward end of its body or chassis
resting upon the body or chassis of the towing vehicle. (q) Superintendent shall mean the Port

Authority official in charge of the particular truck terminal, or the person
properly delegated to perform his functions and duties. (r) Ton shall mean 2000 pounds
avoirdupois. (s) Tractor shall mean
an automotive vehicle designed for drawing other highway vehicles and having no
provision for carrying loads independently. (t) Trailer shall mean a highway vehicle
(other than a semi-trailer) not self-propelled, designed and constructed to be
towed. (u) Truck shall mean an
automotive vehicle designed or used for the transportation of freight, or
registered for such use. (v) Truck
terminal shall mean: (1)

Union Terminal

Freight Station No. 2, located in the Borough of Manhattan and bounded by

Greenwich, West Houston, Washington and Spring Streets; (2)

Union Terminal Freight Station No. 3, located in Newark, New Jersey, north of Delancy Street, east of New Jersey

State Highway Route 25, and south of Bears Stadium. (w) Truck terminal platform shall mean that
area of a truck terminal used for the handling of freight and incidental
storage, excluding storage rooms and the cooperage room. (x) Truck terminal ramps shall mean the two
inclined ways, located on the northwest and northeast corners of Union Terminal

Freight Station No. 2, and which serve as passageways between the street level
and the roof of the said terminal. (y) Vehicle shall mean and include
automobiles, trucks, buses, tractors, trailers, semi-trailers, horse-drawn
carts or wagons and any other devices in or upon or by which any person or
property is or may be transported, carried or drawn upon land, except railroad
rolling equipment or other devices running only on stationary rails or
tracks. (z) Vehicular parking area
shall mean that area of a truck terminal made available by the Port Authority
for the parking of vehicles. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1225.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
